titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller Family Audiovisual materials, General FA751

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-04-10 00:14:19 -0400.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Audiovisual collection is an artificial collection created by the RAC in order to efficiently and effectively manage and present the moving images held among our archival holdings.
This material includes films and moving images in virtually every format available since the early 20th century including but not necessarily limited to: 16mm, 35mm, beta, Super 8, VHS and DVD.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Since the contents of the Film collection have inherently been separated from other archival holdings, the description of any individual item, or set of items, may also currently appear, in some form, in the finding aid for the originating collection.
Future processing, description, and presentation of Films will seek to address this issue as much as feasible.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The majority of Audiovisual materials have been physically separated from a Rockefeller family archival collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: In most cases, the specific details of the provenance are simply unknown.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in 2 series by file type.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 48 business hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may require creation of an access surrogate. Applicable charges will apply.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Rockefeller family films represent a mix of private family footage, and published recordings from a multitude of sources. In the 1970s and 1980s, a reorganization effort duplicated and merged many of the original Rockefeller family films, so there is frequent overlap and repetition of some scenes, and many films contain a mix of private and public footage.
See the Archival Services staff for more information about these films or guidance on finding a scene.
The Rockefeller family (General) films contains moving images of multiple family members.

Thereafter, are individual series focused on materials pertaining to, or otherwise related to, the activities of each prominent member of the Rockefeller family "Brothers Generation". Family members may be referred to by their full name, nickname, or abbreviation (such as NAR).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage from 1931-1933 documenting the George Atwell Construction Company laying the foundation and constructing Rockefeller Center in New York City. Currently only available with timecode.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode from the newsreel series March of Time, a news compilation based on and sponsored by Time Magazine. This series covered national and international stories, using real footage and dramatized recreations, playing as 20 or 30 minute films in movie theaters from 1935 to 1951. HBO maintains copyright of this series. Includes NYC: scenes at Rockefeller Center: the family office, Room 5600; JDR JR working in office; construction; murals and artwork; Radio City and the Rockettes; the Rainbow Room; Rockefeller University; University of Chicago; Colonial Williamsburg.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage from several home movies shot in various locations, compiled in 1963: -10 W. 54th St, NYC: children of JDR, JR. playing inside; Laurance and Winthrop Rockefeller riding scooters inside; Laurance fixing scooter wheel (April 3, 1917) -Pocantico Hills, NY: Abby Rockefeller and sons playing with rabbits; David Rockefeller playing with dog, tricycle; five brothers riding bikes; Babs Rockefeller driving car; brothers riding horses with riding master Joe Plick; JDR JR driving in carriage; scenes of Kykuit; JDR SR golfing; JDR 3rd golfing; family at Union Church; JDR SR, JDR JR, Abby and sons on porch; panorama of the Playhouse (1919?) -JDR SR. in Ormond Beach, FL, reading letter on 60th anniversary of Standard Oil (Jan. 10, 1930) -Newsreel clip "John D. At 92 Leads Singing on Golf Links" (Fox Movietone News) (1931) -Newsreel clip "John D. Urges Faith!" (Paramount News) (1932) -Newsreel clip "Rockefeller Tees Up!" (Paramount News) (1932) -Newsreel clip "Rockefeller Dead at 97!" (Pathe News) (1937) with footage from Pocantico Hills, Riverside Church, Rockefeller Center (1937) -Newsreel clip "Restore Oldest American Castle" (Paramount News) about Philipsburg Manor restoration in Tarrytown NY -Newsreel clip "Scenes of Mr. and Mrs. Rockefeller JR. at Bassett Hall" (5/15/42) -Williamsburg, VA: JDR JR and Abby have tea at Bassett Hall; Abby knitting scarf for war effort; JDR JR reviewing blueprints with Kenneth Chorley and William Perry (May 1942) -Seal Harbor, ME: JDR JR with Abby and Winthrop Rockefeller in uniform in Eyrie Garden (1946)
